column4: does anybody know if there is a windows command so I can boot from a cd? (I want to install ubuntu over broken windows xp)
so your box won't let you boot from CD ?
no, I can start windows in safe mode and I need a command so I can boot from cd
that has nothing to do with windows or ubuntu... that'S a bios thing
well my windows is totally broken (some virusses)
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto have you done the burning right?
well one is done by myself and the other one by someone else.
and you did not burn the *file* to CD, but made an image copy of the .iso, right?
yes I did "burn cd as image"
so you have to tell your BIOS to boot from CD... if it's too old try the smart boot manager or a boot floppy
well I actually can't do much since the computer I want to install it on is full of the worst virusses, so I just want to get in the cd
that's totally irrelevant
you know how to get the BIOS when you start the computer, don't you?
when I enter setup (with F2) it asks me if I want to use safe mode or start windows the normal way, but I don't know another way to get in the BIOS
that's not the BIOS, that's already the windows bootloader... prolly you have to press 'del' or 'esc'
thank you, I'll try those I'll tell if it worked
I can't seem to get in the BIOS it will always go to the screen I told
what make and model is that computer?
it's an old dell on the side it says inspiron 7500
try 'F8' for Dell
http://support.dell.com/support/edocs/systems/psyd/setup.htm
F8 does the same
well I have to go now, I'll fix it later   bye
F2 does the same
